title: Drawing, Design for a Combination Radio and Phonograph Cabinet with Sliding Top and Folding Doors, April 27, 1937
title_raw: Design for a Combination Radio and Phonograph Cabinet with Sliding Top and Folding Doors
medium: graphite, blue pencil on tracing paper, ruled border in graphite
markings: Stamps: Small stamp in black ink at lower right:DONALD DESKEY/630 FIFTH AVENUE/NEW YORK CITY
inscribed: Inscribed in graphite throughout: Top Slides Under/Folding Doors; Space ForRecord Books/Insided Doors/Phonograph/Loudspeakers; at lower left: CABINET CLOSED.; at lower right: CABINET OPEN.; across left bottom margin: COMBINA TION RADIO=& PHONOGRAPH CABINET WITH SLIDING TOP & FOLDING DOORS; at lower right corner: APRIL 27.-1937; inscribed in blue pencil at center left: FIG.I; at center right: FIG. II
description: Three views of design for a radio-phonograph cabinet with sliding top and folding doors showing cabinet closed, opening, and fully opened. Rectilinear cabinet with curving edge and two folding doors with horizontal pulls that conceal phonograph.
gallery_text: Industrial designer Donald Deskey’s 1930s furniture designs unite form and function. Inspired by the simple sophistication of contemporary Scandinavian wooden furniture, this radio cabinet’s rectilinear shape, curved edge, and horizontal pulls allow the beauty of its materials to add interest and ornamentation. With folding doors and a sliding top, the versatile cabinet allows for easy storage and demonstrates the integration of radio technology in the furnishings of a modern home.
